Yanira de Los Angeles Riffo Vasquez

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/1852157990336427
  • Última atualização do currículo em 02/10/2008

Possui graduação em Licenciatura plena e Bacharelado em Biologia pela Universidade de São Paulo (1986), mestrado em Imunologia pela Universidade de São Paulo (1992) e doutorado em Imunologia pela Universidade de São Paulo (1996). Atualmente é pesquisador - Sackler Institute-king's College London. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2007 - 2011
Role of Mycobacterium tuberculosys chaperonin 60.1and its peptides in a murine model or airways inflammation and hyperresponsiveness
Descrição: The objectives of the research carried out in the Sackler Institute of Pharmacology are to investigate the anti-inflammatory properties of chaperonins in a model of allergic inflammation. The results extend our previous findings showing that both Cpn60.1 and Cpn10 inhibited allergic inflammatory responses in vivo, and at the cellular level were able to inhibit dendritic cell function which might explain the anti-inflammatory properties of these molecules in vivo. The structural determinant of this anti-inflammatory property of Cpn60.1 remains to be established. Therefore, various peptide sequences of Cpn60.1 were investigated for potential anti-inflammatory properties in vitro and in vivo. A number of these peptides appeared to have immunomodulatory activity in vitro and anti-inflammatory properties in vivo, suggesting that the structural determinants of the activity residing within chaperonins is amenable to interrogation with the view of finding novel anti-inflammatory agents..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Yanira de Los Angeles Riffo Vasquez - Coordenador / Professor Anthony Coates - Integrante / Professor Clive page - Integrante / Dr. Dom Spina - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Helperby - Auxílio financeiro.
2007 - Atual
Role of MKK3 in a murine model of allergic inflammation
Descrição: In this project we use mice deficient in the expression of this kinase (KO mice). The main aim of this study is to establish the role of the map kinase 3 (MKK3) in the physiopathology of asthma and allergies using a mouse model. The model has been describen in the literature (RIffo-Vasquez, Y. et al, Clin. Exp. Allergy 2007; Mar;37(3):459-70).
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Yanira de Los Angeles Riffo Vasquez - Coordenador.
2004 - Atual
Role of sex hormones in a murine model of allergic inflammation
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Yanira de Los Angeles Riffo Vasquez - Coordenador / Dr. Wothan Tavares de Lima - Integrante.

Outras informações relevantes

 
Research experience

a) During my PhD project I have worked with a murine model of skin inflammation. This project involved cell quantification, inflammatory mediator measurement, RNA analysis (PCR) and pharmacological manipulation. In this project I was also directly involved in the selection and maintenance of specially selected mice strains.

a) During my post-doctoral period I have developed a model of airways inflammation and hyperresponsiveness in the mouse. This model allows us to measure cell trafficking to the airways, quantifying inflammatory mediator release. Furthermore, the model is also suitable to measure in vivo lung mechanics using an invasive method and also to quantify cell populations in the lung using immunohistochemistry, conventional histology and FACScan analysis.

b)  Using this model I am currently responsible for three projects involving the effect of MKK3/MKK6 M, Tuberculosis chaperonins and sex hormones in the modulation of allergic lung inflammation and hyperresponsiveness. The last two projects have produced publications.

c) Using my expertise as immunopharmacologist, I developed and adapted new methodology in the Sackler Institute that is currently been used by other colleagues. 


d) Currently I have the postion of Research fellow at the Sackler Institute of Pulmonary Pharmacology. In my position I am responsible for various projects and the  develoment of new techniques. I have closely supervised PhD students in the development of their projects in the respiratory field and also in the analysis of their results.

e) I have an active colaboration with colleagues at the University of Sao Paulo: Dr. Wothan Tavares de Lima and Dra. Soraia Costa both from the department of Pharmacology, ICB/USP. My colaboration with Dr. Tavares de Lima has resulted  in publications. With Dr. Costa we have a paper in  process of writing.
